titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 550
CWG11579

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMNET,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, December 11th, 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 550.

15. At the request of the Governor of Kentucky, Private John Ellis, Company "B," 1st Kentucky Cavalry, is hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States, to enable him to accept a commission.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

1 Cavy
Private Ellis
Discharged
Filed Jany 4. 1864
